bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 68 (Monday, April 24, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. McHENRY:H.R. 2799.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8, Clause 3: To regulate commerce withstates, other nations, and Native American tribes.Article 1, Section 8, Clause 18:Authority to create laws that are necessary and proper tocarry out the laws of the landThe single subject of this legislation is:To make reforms to the capital markets of the United States[Page H1915]

item.title: Investment Opportunity Expansion Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.title: HALOS Act of 2023

latestAction.text: Ordered to be Reported in the Nature of a Substitute (Amended) by the Yeas and Nays: 35 - 12.

item.title: Improving Disclosure for Investors Act of 2023

latestAction.text: Ordered to be Reported in the Nature of a Substitute (Amended) by Voice Vote.

item.title: To permit an issuer, when determining the market capitalization of the issuer for purposes of testing the significance of an acquisition or disposition, to include the value of all shares of the issuer.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.title: Restoring the Secondary Trading Market Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.title: To amend the Securities Act of 1933 to expand the research report exception to include reports about any issuer that undertakes a proposed offering of public securities.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.title: Small Business Investor Capital Access Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.title: Developing and Empowering our Aspiring Leaders Act of 2023

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.title: Unlocking Capital for Small Businesses Act of 2023

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.title: To require the Securities and Exchange Commission to revise certain thresholds related to smaller reporting companies, accelerated filers, and large accelerated filers, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.title: To amend the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 to exclude qualified institutional buyers and institutional accredited investors when calculating holders of a security for purposes of the mandatory registration threshold under such Act, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.title: To require auditor independence standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board and the Securities and Exchange Commission applicable to past audits of a company occurring before it was a public company to treat an auditor as independent if the auditor meets established professional standards, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.title: Improving Crowdfunding Opportunities Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.title: SEED Act of 2023

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.title: Gig Worker Equity Compensation Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Financial Services, and in addition to the Committee on Education and the Workforce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

item.title: Helping Startups Continue To Grow Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.title: To lower the aggregate market value of voting and non-voting common equity necessary for an issuer to qualify as a well-known seasoned issuer.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.title: Increasing Investor Opportunities Act

latestAction.text: Ordered to be Reported in the Nature of a Substitute (Amended) by the Yeas and Nays: 37 - 11.

item.title: Regulation A+ Improvement Act of 2023

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.title: To amend the definition of an accredited investor to include individuals receiving advice from certain professionals, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.title: Improving Capital Allocation for Newcomers Act of 2021

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.title: Retirement Fairness for Charities and Educational Institutions Act of 2023

latestAction.text: Ordered to be Reported in the Nature of a Substitute (Amended) by the Yeas and Nays: 35 - 12.

item.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 112.
Committee on Education and the Workforce discharged.
Committee on Education and the Workforce discharged.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Financial Services. H. Rept. 118-143, Part I.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Financial Services. H. Rept. 118-143, Part I.
Ordered to be Reported in the Nature of a Substitute (Amended) by the Yeas and Nays: 28 - 21.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

Referred to the Committee on Financial Services, and in addition to the Committee on Education and the Workforce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
